entries.meaning: (taxonomy) The process by which new distinct species evolve.
(chemistry) The formation of different (inorganic) species (especially of ions) as the environment changes.
examples: English Wikipedia has an article on:Speciation of ionsWikipedia

entries.meaning: (medicine, pathology) The determination of which species is/are present in a fluid or tissue specimen, bacterial culture, or viral culture.
examples: requirements specifying speciation and serotyping in addition to reporting of presence or absence
